entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale west to northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: The chance of upgrade to Red has decreased.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Watch has been decreased to Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: West to northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places, especially about Central Hawke's Bay. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is forecast to affect the road Thursday night above 700 metres, and continue to affect the road through Friday, lowering to about 500 metres overnight. 1 to 3 cm may accumulate on the road around the east portal by midnight tonight, then a further 8 to 15 cm may accumulate about the eastern portal during Friday until late afternoon, with lesser amounts down to 500 metres.
